newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - July 10.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - July 10.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Henri Konan Bedie signs decrees selling state sugar firm Societe pour le Developpement des Plantations de Canne a Sucre (SODESUCRE) in two blocs, one to a consortium led by Ivorian commodities group SIFCA and the second to a French-led consortium including Brasseries et Glacieres Internationales, Matignon Investissement and Sucreries d'Ertein.

- West African accounting system (SYSCOA), to be introduced from January 1 in the eight-nation Economic and Monetary Union of West African States UEMOA, will prove a tool for greater regional integration, experts say.

- Government decides to build a security wall round Ivory Coast's biggest university campus, Cocody, in commercial capital Abidjan. Campus has been scene of clashes between students, disputing level of grant payments and seeking changes in academic and living conditions, and security forces.
- Ivory Coast seeks to cut its illiteracy rate from 57 percent to 20 percent by 2005.

- Cabinet decides to revamp Abidjan's CCIA international trade tower, which is currently almost 70 percent occupied by government departments, and restore it to its initial vocation as a venue where businesses can work from and meet one another.
- Government targets February 1998 for start of construction of an Abidjan exhibition and trade fair park.
- Ivory Coast's positive rating in political, business and media circles in France rises from 79 percent in June 1996 to 87 percent in June 1997, a poll conducted there shows.
- President signs decree setting up National Environment Agency.
- Ivory Coast's pig breeders, their sector devastated by an outbreak of African swine fever in 1996, plan to set up a trade body to represent their interests.
- Head of state forest management agency SODEFOR calls for national coalition to protect and develop Ivory Coast's disappearing rain forest.
